Comment: This is a lot closer to iNsUrReCtIoN than January 6th was. This is a state (really multiple states) passing state laws that violate federal law, when federal law is the supreme law of the land. Not only is it happening in the realm of immigration, with states harboring aliens, but they also pass laws that violate the Second Amendment. Federal marijuana laws are wantonly violated by many states too. This is the problem that results from so many executive administrations just choosing to ignore laws that they don't want to enforce. It's then an uphill battle for a subsequent administration to actually do their job and enforce all federal laws. If the People want a federal law to go unenforced, Congress has to appeal it or the Supreme Court has to rule it unconstitutional.   States have their own sovereignty, but when their laws conflict with federal laws it's the federal laws that matter. It's the Constitution that matters. The Federal government can't force states to enforce federal law, but they can punish states for violating federal law, such as federal laws against Alien Harboring, which makes it illegal to harbor any alien or entice or encourage any alien to come to or remain in the United States.¬†
